alert.note: Alert for Wise (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 28 at 7:23AM EDT until July 28 at 10:00AM EDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Morristown has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Wise County in southwestern Virginia... * Until 1000 AM EDT. * At 723 AM EDT, Emergency management reported flooding along Riverside Drive in Pound and several places along Main Street in Pound. Showers and thunderstorms produced heavy rain across the warned area over the last several hours. Between 2.5 and 4 inches of rain has fallen from gauge reports and radar estimates. The Pound River gauge above Indian Creek and also the gauge below Bold Camp Creek were above flood stage and still rising. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Wise, Pound and Pardee. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
